clinical_study.official_title: LearningRx Cognitive Training for Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI): A Multiple Baseline Study Across Cases

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this investigation is to conduct a series of case studies on the impact of LearningRx cognitive training on cognitive skills, brain structure, and daily functioning for participants with Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI).

detailed_description.textblock: Using a multiple baseline design across cases with start point randomization, the proposed study will examine the outcomes from LearningRx one-on-one cognitive training across domains on standardized measures used to monitor treatment effectiveness for TBI.

primary_outcome.measure: Evidence of overall cognitive function improvement
primary_outcome.time_frame: within 14 days after completing the intervention
primary_outcome.description: Confirmed by change in pretest to post-test scores on the Woodcock Johnson IV - Tests of Cognitive Abilities

secondary_outcome.measure: Evidence of change in brain activity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 30 days after completing the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: As confirmed by pretest to post-test changes in electrical activity measured by qEEG

secondary_outcome.measure: Evidence of reduction in TBI symptoms
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 14 days after completing the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: As confirmed by pretest to post-test changes on the Traumatic Brain Injury Checklist

secondary_outcome.measure: Evidence of change in brain structure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 30 days after completing the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Confirmed by change in pretest to post-test neuroimaging using MRI

secondary_outcome.measure: Evidence of improvement in visual attention
secondary_outcome.time_frame: with 14 days after completing the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Confirmed by change in pretest to post-test scores on the Conners Continous Performance Test (CPT-3)

secondary_outcome.measure: Evidence of improvement in auditory attention
secondary_outcome.time_frame: with 14 days after completing the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Confirmed by change in pretest to post-test scores on the Auditory Attention Test (CATA)

arm_group.description: The intervention is a 60-hour, clinician-delivered cognitive training program.

intervention.description: A clinician will deliver three 90-minute cognitive training sessions per week for 14 weeks. There are 16 different categories of leveled training procedures sequenced in intensity and difficulty for a total of 530 training tasks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 18+ previously diagnosed with TBI
- Living in the greater Colorado Springs area
Exclusion Criteria:
- No braces, metal implants, or claustrophobia that would contraindicate magnetic resonance imaging
